column4: I wish to figure out what is going on, sometimes I get ridiculous spike on the cpu that lasts for a few seconds and lags my browser, how do I go finding out why?
sounds like your browser is causing those CPU spikes.  maybe uninstall some plugins.
no it has happened before and with only four plugins installed I doubt that will consume 100% cpu :s
some of those plugins will cause more problems then you think
true say just wished to figure out why exactly it happens at completely random times and days
I would start by disabling all plugins, then slowly enable them one by one to find out which one is causing teh problem
you're assuming it is the browser plugin but right now i am surfing without a problem not even one lag and i am on facebook *shocked* no lags, I very much doubt it is the browser
I'm pretty sure it is your browser.  Because I had the exact same problem, but you don't need to take my advice, thats fine :)
it is not about not taking your advise it is that I believe that is very unlikely since its completely random i.e. days/weeks/months etc.
hey just FYI I was unsuccessful in recovering data with testdisk.  It did recover the partitions though..
I see, was it because you repartitioned first or because the data had been overwritten?
I am curious to know what went wrong
I think it was because I repartitioned. I think it may have worked if I had just deleted the partition and not written over it with a new one.  test # 2 I guess :)
will wait for test 2, if you wouldn't mind could you write your results in the forum, I'll be able to read exactly what you did and how you did it
I want to test it on a failed HDD, but i need to find one first.
yeah I will document the next test in a post

just make your hdd fail I bet you can find ways to do so online without actually breaking it, I know a while back I found one to test how many writes you can do on a usb before it completely fail lol, wonder if it cna be changed to hd instead but you may not be able to recover it afterwards :s
axel
it works like wget
downloads from multiple sources as well
nope I want to keep track of the download speed not do multiple connections to a server in attempt to speed up download
it does that as well.
or just put the output of wget to a log file..
